meanings.definition: A person who has a form of color blindness in which only two of the three primary colors can be distinguished.
meanings.sent1: Some dichromats may struggle to tell the difference between red and green.
meanings.sent2: The eye doctor explained that dichromats see the world differently than others.
meanings.sent3: At the art class, the dichromats accidentally mixed up blue and purple paint.
meanings.sent4: In a world of dichromats, the sky would always look like a mix of blue and yellow.
meanings.sent5: The dichromats' unique vision made them appreciate the beauty of black and white photography.

meanings.sent1: The museum featured an exhibit on dichromats and their experiences with color.
meanings.sent2: The researchers interviewed several dichromats to understand their perspective on color.
meanings.sent3: During the party, the dichromats joked about forming a club for color-challenged individuals.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of dichromats, the world seemed to lose some of its vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The dichromats' unique view of the world inspired an artist to create a series of paintings.
